review_title: Once-great college, rapidly headed down the wrong track
job_title: Assistant Professor in Rock Island, IL
pros: Great students, great faculty (not all, but some), and wonderful staff make this a potentially wonderful place to work. And the campus is beautifully landscaped.
cons: The Quad Cities is an economically depressed area and so there's not much to do outside of the Augustana campus. The bigger problem, however, is the current administration, which is cutting faculty, pursuing "certificates" (without really understanding what they are) and online classes (without investing any money into the IT support they would need to create good ones, or having done any research into the pedagogy that makes for successful blended classes, etc.) and any other fad that comes along. The salaries of the president and his top stooges keep rising while the staff and the faculty cuts keep increasing.

review_title: Great people but losing direction under current leadership
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Rock Island, IL
pros: The people I worked with at Augustana were second to none! Having also attended the institution as a student, I was well-versed in the culture and the Augustana community spirit for many years before becoming a professional. Within your department you are highly valued by peers and colleagues and proud of the work that you do.
cons: Over the years Augustana seems to have lost its way somewhat. Originally, I found the campus to be a very welcoming one, where everyone greeted every passerby like they were friends. The culture has changed significantly over the last decade and while you feel valued in your department, you do not always feel your department is valued by the higher powers.  In my opinion, Augustana has become more of an obvious business than the community it once was. I feel that people are valued less and departments are given less and less to work with in order to achieve objectives.

review_title: Augustana is a great place to work.
